climbs.name: Wisky Bench
climbs.fa: 5/30/2012 Zack G, Laura Dewe, Greg M

content.description:
Good / long heavily bolted climb. Reasonably fun, but I don't know about the 10a rating. Felt more like 8 to me but I'm honoring the FA's rating.

Great route for someone breaking into the grade or leading.

Has bolts at 60 and 70 m.
content.location:
Currently 3rd from the right, up the face on the RHS.

Pick up the guide at IME ($10) -- the money goes to pay for all the bolts these guys are putting up.

content.description:
Start on Melting into Madness and start veering right after the third bolt. The first bolt as this line breaks to the right is only a couple feet to the right of the 4th bolt of Melting into Madness, the line continues to move up and to the right, distancing itself from the Melting into Madness bolt line. After splitting off from Melting into Madness, the route takes you up a thin face before easing up towards the top. The face is of similar difficulty when compared to Cotton Mouth but the climb isn't as sustained as Cotton Mouth.

I tentatively put Greg M and Tyler P as the first ascent on this since they did many of the routes on the wall, including the routes immediately to the left and right of this one.  I had seen the grade .10c suggested by a few other climbers, but I'm not sure on the FA's stated grade. If anyone can confirm some of this information or provide some new information on this route (such as a name) just comment or shoot me a PM and I'll adjust the information accordingly.
content.location: To the left of Public Nuisance, start on the first three bolts of Melting into Madness and then veer right.

content.description: This climb is tricky with small edges, pockets and knobs with a fun small roof to navigate.
content.location: So this climb is the most right on this wall. Its bolts form a backwards C. Starts low move up right then turns the roof moving to the left. New addition to this wall. There are now 5 lines on this wall.

content.protection:
13 bolts to chains.

60 m rope only and you won't have much to spare.
content.location:
Sinistar sits West of the pillar that marks the left end of the Melting Mud Wall. Approach as for Melting Mud, skip the last switchback and head West to a giant alcove featuring 3 layers of rock: compact black, sandy rounded white and brittle looking gray. Kinda like a layered cake. One that tastes like sand and choss.

Scramble up into the alcove looking for an old trinket bolt at the base of a steep blocky section of black rock. Look up and be scared. You should see another bolted line to your right. If you don't, you're about to get spanked on

Septic Death

.

content.description: The climbing on the dark grey rock is cool and kinda funky edging and positional climbing. Then a sandy roof requiring an attentive belayer ready for a soft catch. The last third of the climb has really fun pocket and edge climbing on some of the best rock up there. The last third more than compensates for the middle so keep your head down and persevere.
content.location: This is the 2nd line right of Sinistar and the right-most line in the alcove on the heavily featured headwall.

climbs.name: Repeat and Offend
climbs.fa: 2/26/05 Clark O, Greg M, Duncan M, Aaron W

content.location: 1st 4 bolts of Melting into the Madness then left for 5 more
melting mud wall

content.description: Sustained edge and pocket pulling.  Much easier once you find the good pockets but still there in your face.  I really like this one because its nice and sustained.
content.protection: 11 draws plus two for the anchors.
content.location: Right of the shallow dihedral for Melting Into Madness

climbs.name: Pogo Punk
climbs.fa: Oct 6 08 Deanna Lee. Greg Martinez. Laura Dewey. Scott

content.location: left of Altatraz on the pinnacle

climbs.name: Minor Threat
climbs.fa: 9/17/05 Kevin R, Clark O, Greg M

content.location: far right side

content.description: A really fun .10 with lots of really big jugs interspersed between nice pockets and crimps.  This has two pitches and the first has two variations - one in the dihedral and one on the face but I'm not sure how those guys meant for it to go.  I just know if you link both pitches together in one long pitch its a really fun climb.  Just enough jugs and rests to avoid being .11
content.protection: 10 or 20 (or 21?) draws with some being long runners if you want to link both pitches, a 70m rope gets up and back down to the ground.
content.location: a shallow dihedral on the middle to left of the Far East Gate.

content.location: melting mud wall

content.protection: 6 Bolts To Same Anchors as Pogo Punk
content.location: on Right Side of Pinnacle

climbs.name: Martinez Mind Melter
climbs.fa: Aug 12 08 Mike Bird Greg Martinez Laura Dewey

content.protection: 15 Bolts & chains 60 meter rope only tie knot in end of rope when lowering
content.location: left of sinistar
2nd climb from east side of wall

content.description:
Starts sort of hard then there is break as the climb trends up and left towards

Brain Donner

. The climbing is a good mix of crimps, pockets, side pulls and an undercling or two.

The holds change but the route is sustained. Good fun.
content.location: Look for the route with a length of chain on the 2nd bolt.
melting mud wall
2nd pitch to Melting into the Madness.  Uou can do both routes in one pitch with a 70 meter rope.  Watch end when lowering.
